EventsDetail.Title: Mystery Dinner - Chicago 1928
EventsDetail.BodyCopy:
Chicago 1928:

It's 1928 in Chicago the era of glamour, flappers, gangsters, jazz, and speakeasies. Infamous gangster Harold "Hal" Coppone has just been released from jail. You are invited to spend the evening at S.P. Keasys place, a private club near Coppone's headquarters. Upon arriving you discover he has been murdered and his millions of dollars has been stolen.

In this game you and your fellow dinner guests are suspects in the case. Everyone one has a motive for Coppone's death and no one can be trusted. Play the role of one of the eight suspects; Molly M. Awbsterr, Ernie "Bet a MIllion" G. Ambler, Penelope "Silky" Adam, Eddie "Socks" R. Gyle, Malissa "Scoop" F. Orrthot, S. Treighton Harrow, Anna Maria Carlotta "Torchy" Sassine, and Billy "The Kid" Thrower. Come in costume and practice your Chicago accent. Solve the mystery of Coppone's death while enjoying dinner.

When: Wednesday, March 13, 2013
Time: 6:30- 8:30 PM
Where: Hinckley 286 Multipurpose
Price: $8.50 with I-Card
Must be in seat 15 minutes before - Costumes encouraged (no face painting)
 
Menu:
Salad
Cranberry Citrus Chicken
Cheesecake

Character Descriptions:

Molly M. Awbsterr: A society dame from New York, where the Awbsterrs are a prominent and respected family. Molly came to Chicago for the action and because, in her own words, "Chicago is a fun town." Molly is a flapper from the top of the feather in her hat to the tip of her satin shoes.
Costume suggestion: Fringed flapper dress, long bead necklace, and headband with a feather.

Ernie "Bet a Million" G. Ambler: Chicago's most colorful millionaire gambler, He actively plays the stock market, but his favorite game is poker and he can be found at a table in the notorious back room of Chicago's Green Tables. Ernie is flamboyant, outspoken, always ostentatiously dressed, and never without his diamond stickpin.
Costume Suggestion: Flashy (ostentatious) suit and diamond stickpin.

"Silky" Adam: Silky is a shady lady who owns and operates The Everlay Club, Chicago's most prominent private and elegant establishment. The young and beautiful owner became known as "Silky" for the elegant silk gowns she was accustomed to wearing in the evenings.
Costume Suggestion: Silk evening gown and shimmering bead necklace.

Eddie "Socks" R. Gyle: Smooth, fashionable and clever, Eddie is an avid golfer and spends most afternoons on the links at the exclusive Lake View Country Club dressed elegantly in golf pants and argyle socks. In the evenings he can be found at his exclusive gaming house in downtown Chicago, known simply as Green Tables.
Costume Suggestion: Golf pants, argyle socks, bow tie, sweater vest, and golf cap.

Malissa F. Orrthat "Scoop": As a young reporter for the city's leading paper, The Chicago Trumpet, Scoop quickly made a name for herself on the crime beat, later covering the political scene. Her considerable beauty and lively charm have undoubtedly helped further her career, and she enjoys a broad circle of influential and powerful friends.
Costume Suggestion: Trench coat and business suit.

S. Treighton Harrow: U.S. District Attorney and chief opponent to the criminal element in Chicago, Harrow is single-handedly responsible for bringing to justice several of crime's most despicable practitioners. Amidst the corruption and complacency that characterize Chicago law enforcement, Harrow stands out as a shining example. 
Costume Suggestion: Suit and briefcase

Anna Maria Carlotta Sassine "Torchy": Currently the featured singer at Ernie Gyle's Green Tables, Torchy has also appeared in many of the exclusive night clubs of Chicago and has sung with many of the town's tip jazz bands. Her smoldering beauty and sultry voice contribute to Torchy's appeal, as does an extensive repertoire that includes the latest in Chicago jazz, as well as more traditional blues numbers.
Costume Suggestion: Shimmering sequined gown.

Billy "The Kid" Thrower: Star Pitcher for the Chicago Stock Kings major league baseball team, Billy was born to play baseball. Off the field, Billy is as fun loving, warm-hearted, and brawling as a baseball player can be.
Costume Suggestion: Baseball uniform.
